intro: Meioluma guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan meioluma, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Meioluma guianensis is typically found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
